p: A method to monitor the uncoating/disassembly of the capsid of influenza A virus, which enters the cell by endocytosis, also is based on ultracentrifugation ( Stauffer et al., 2016). Purified virions are separated using velocity gradient centrifugation through a two-layer glycerol gradient. Similar to the “ in vitro core stability” assay for HIV, the sedimenting viruses migrate through the detergent-containing layer of the gradient, which dissolves the membrane to release the viral core. Moreover, modification of the detergent-containing glycerol layer—for example, by lowering pH, changing ionic strength, or adding putative viral uncoating factors—enables study of the factors or compounds that affect viral uncoating in vitro.
